greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Generalized Fubini numbers. Square array read by ascending antidiagonals, A(n,k) = 1 + k*(Sum_{j=1..n-1} C(n,j)*A(j,k)); n>=0 and k>=0.
comment: M. Mureşan defined the generalized Fubini numbers as the enumerators of the k-labelled ordered p partitions of an n-set.
reference: M. Mureşan, On the generalized Fubini numbers. (Romanian) Stud. Cercet. Mat. 37, 70-76 (1985).
link: Robert Gill, The number of elements in a generalized partition semilattice, Discrete mathematics 186.1-3 (1998): 125-134. See Example 1.
N. Kilar and Y. Simsek, A new family of Fubini type numbers and polynomials associated with Apostol-Bernoulli numbers and polynomials, J. Korean Math. Soc. 54 (5) (2017) 1605-1621.
formula: A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-1} k^j*j!*{n,j+1} for n>0, else 1; {n,j} denotes the Stirling subset numbers.
A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-1} k^(n-j-1)*(k+1)^j*<n,j> for n>0, else 1; <n,j> denotes the Eulerian numbers.
maple: egf := k -> 1+1/(1/(exp(z)-1)-k): # egf of column k
for k from 0 to 4 do seq(j!*coeff(series(egf(k),z,10),z,j),j=0..8) od;
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = 1 + k Sum[Binomial[n, j] A[j, k], {j, 1, n - 1}]; Table[A[n - k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 30 2016 *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, May 08 2015
